nodes.bodyText: is this just removing the qualification or are you actually changing the result type?
This is actually changing the result type. The SourceResultAdapter now returns an org.mule.sdk.api.runtime.operation.Result .
where is the ReconnectableHeisenbergSource being readded? Aren't you missing  the new @Sources annotation here?
I think it was the same for the test having it or not, but I am adding it back with the new @Sources annotation.
why do you need a different key for the legacy callback? Shouldn't the adapters allow you to handle eveything as one unique code flow?

What I did is to add a variable to the context that is the source callback context adapted to the legacy one, I could instead have only the new implementation, get it, and adapt it here. Do you think that is better?
I will make the Argument resolver wrap the callback context with the adapter, and have only the org.mule.sdk variable in the context.
It was renamed because it now holds an SdkSourceFactory, which is a new interface defined here https://github.com/mulesoft/mule-extensions-api/pull/758/files .
this is taking an "all or nothing" approach, meaning that you either have sources fully defined with the legacy API or fully defined with the new API. Add cases for sources that mix both.

nodes.bodyText: LegacySourceCallbackContextAdapterAdapter -> Class has double Adapter suffix.
This is assuming that a legacy callback will always be obtained and should always be adapted. Leave this read to function when the new API so that we don't have to touch it again when the time comes
add a comment explaining that you're intentionally mixing annotations in order to test all code flows
